Title: On .NET Live | Building Real-World AI Agents with Agent Framework
Description:
How do we move from AI hype to real outcomes? In this talk, Vic Perdana demos SemantiClip, an open-source AI agent that transforms video into blog content using the new Agent Framework or AF (next evolution of Semantic Kernel + Autogen) and Azure AI Foundry.

Learn how to build practical, interoperable agents using AF‚Äôs agent and process frameworks. With insights on orchestration patterns and when to use each framework, you‚Äôll be ready to build real-world AI experiences This session explores the practical architecture of AI agents using Agent Framework, with a focus on composability, interoperability, and real-world orchestration. Vic will walk through SemantiClip, an open-source project that converts video content into structured blog posts using both local and cloud-based LLMs. The agent showcases AI-based planning, tool calling, and integration with the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for structured memory and cross-agent context sharing, enabling persistent, context-aware workflows. We‚Äôll dive into AF‚Äôs agent and process frameworks, and explore how to choose between them, or use both in tandem, for different orchestration needs. Whether you‚Äôre building a co-pilot, workflow automation, or multi-agent system, you‚Äôll leave with open-source patterns and real-world lessons you can apply right away.
